Tucson holds Vestige and bravely walks out of the car, and toward the sound=
 of Rodimus's voice.

"I'M HERE RODIMUS, KEEP CALLING TO ME, I'LL FIND YOU!=
  IF YOUR EYES HAVE FAILED YOU, REMEMBER, YOU STILL HAVE YOUR OTHER SENSES!=
"

Tucson somewhat could make a connection. Was Vestige a part of Rodimus? =
 Every time Rodimus sounded in dispair, Vestige went off line.  And each ti=
me the insects got closser, his power would diminish to the point where he =
falls lifeless.  He makes connections. Vestige had the same colors as Rodim=
us.  Was this perhaps his inner soul helpless in his arms?  

" Don't worry=
 my friend. Even in darkness there is light.  And what if I were to physica=
lly brighten things up a bit?  These arachnids don't seem to like the light=
 do they?  I wonder..."

He now turns on his high beams to luminate the are=
a, attempting to see if light was one of the insects weak spots.  He keeps =
it on as he walks forward, hoping to find Rodimus.

" Time to play the Exte=
rminator."

--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Preston Carroll <supercyclonus@.=
..> wrote:
>
> > Tucson had no time to be alarmed. He is quick to kneel dow=
n to Vestige, and picks him up gently. He was not about to leave him behind=
.
> >
> > "They're comming, Vestige, hold on, we may not be able to escape =
the horde, but we can lose them long enough to get our bearings."
> >
> > T=
ucson takes his chances and prepares to get off the rail car, hoping to at =
least get Vestige to a safe place, even if it were just for a few moments, =
to assemble a reasonable strategy to get rid of the horde, perhaps even van=
quish them.
> >
> > "There has to be some way to stop them. Everything has =
a weakness, it's just a matter of finding it. No radar, no sonar, looks lik=
e my eyes will have to do."
> >
> 
> Vesige stirred again as Tuscon talked,=
 his voice was weak as he spoke,
> "They are trying to corrupt this world."=
 He paused as if trying to
> dredge up enough energy to continue speaking, =
"When they arrived
> everything . . . . changed."
> 
> Even as Vestige talk=
ed the car slid into a dark tunnel the buzzing
> outside could be heard sti=
ll getting louder as the insects tried to
> follow the car inside, although=
 the width of the tunnel was slowing
> them down a little.
> 
> The car pul=
led into a dimly lit station and the magnacar door slid
> open to display a=
n empty platform. The platform was pretty standard as
> platforms go, gun m=
etal grey walls, steel beams acting as pillars were
> positioned evenly at =
different parts of the room.
> 
> "TUSCON!" came Rodimus' voice. "WHERE ARE=
 YOU TUSCON, I CAN'T SEE YOU!"
> 
> It echoed throught the station. A look =
at Vestige showed him to be
> unconscious again.
> 
> (TAG)
> 
> Preston
